content.description: <math alttext="The figure presents a 2 row table with 4 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “g of x.” The data are as follows. Column 1. x is negative 3. g of x is 12. Column 2. x is negative 1. g of x is 0. Column 3. x is 1. g of x is 1. Column 4. x is 3. g of x is negative 4." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em " equalrows="true" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0.5ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="1ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.25ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mn>12</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>
content.question: Selected values of a function <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></math> are shown in the table above. What is the average rate of change of <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></math> over the interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 3 comma 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator 3 minus negative 3, and denominator negative 4 minus 12, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator negative 4 minus 12, and denominator 3 minus negative 3, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 12 plus negative 4, and denominator 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>12</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator 12 plus 0, plus 1, plus negative 4, and denominator 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>12</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator negative 4 minus 12, and denominator 3 minus negative 3, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></math>

topic.text: 2.1: Defining Average and Instantaneous Rates of Change at a Point

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
